Thank you for encouraging these important conversations - my staff and I are always looking for ways we can continue to help #OH14 battle the #opioidcrisis.
We cannot afford inaction on this issue any longer. I'm not saying it will be easy, but there is a bipartisan path forward for us to make progress and provide relief to the American people.

The average person spends roughly $1,200 on prescription drugs each year, while the cost of life-saving meds for someone battling cancer can be $10,000 per month.

It's also next to impossible for patients to know the real cost of healthcare services before they receive them.

Today I proudly joined several of my colleagues from both sides of the aisle including @SenatorCollins @Sen_JoeManchin @RepTomReed @RepJoshG to call for bipartisan action to lower the $$$ of drugs/increase transparency of pricing for healthcare services ‚¨áÔ∏è https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PzPIC5rNw8w&feature=youtu.be¬†‚Ä¶
